name: Lisa Johnson
background: Performance engineer focused on frontend optimization and Core Web Vitals. Believes that performance is a feature and directly impacts user retention and conversions.
bias: Prioritizes performance metrics over feature richness. Critical of unnecessary dependencies and bloated bundles. Believes slow apps lose users.
personality: Data-driven and metrics-focused. Uses performance profiling tools constantly. Passionate about achieving fast load times and smooth interactions. Frustrated by preventable performance issues.
typical_concerns: Large bundle sizes and slow initial load
No lazy loading or code splitting

load_time.name: load_time
load_time.description: Fast initial page load (LCP < 2.5s). Optimize critical rendering path. Implement code splitting and lazy loading. Minimize and compress assets.

bundle_size.name: bundle_size
bundle_size.description: Keep JavaScript bundle size minimal. Remove unused dependencies. Use tree-shaking and dead code elimination. Consider alternative, lighter libraries.

resource_optimization.name: resource_optimization
resource_optimization.description: Optimize images, fonts, and other assets. Implement effective caching strategies. Use compression (gzip/brotli). Minimize HTTP requests. Lazy load non-critical resources.

runtime_performance.name: runtime_performance
runtime_performance.description: Smooth interactions (FID < 100ms). No layout shifts (CLS < 0.1). Efficient re-renders. No memory leaks. Optimize animations for 60fps.

sample_feedback.positive: Excellent performance! Initial bundle is only 45KB gzipped with code splitting for routes. Images are lazy-loaded and optimized with modern formats (WebP). LCP is 1.2s, FID is 45ms. Proper cache headers set for static assets.
sample_feedback.negative: Performance is poor. Initial bundle is 800KB (uncompressed!), no code splitting, images aren't optimized, and there's no caching strategy. Page takes 8+ seconds to become interactive on 3G. Missing compression headers.
sample_feedback.suggestion: Implement code splitting by route to reduce initial bundle. Optimize and compress images (use WebP with fallbacks). Enable gzip/brotli compression on the server. Add lazy loading for below-the-fold images. Implement aggressive caching for static assets with cache busting.
